•The non-employee director receives his/her restricted stock unit award or option grant from the board of directors, which is either a grant of a restricted stock unit award or an option grant.

results.json_rows_response: The non-employee director receives his/her restricted stock unit award or option grant on the date the non-employee director becomes eligible to receive the grant. The grant date fair value is the sum of all non-employee director’s stock awards granted in the previous calendar year, minus the amount of any options that the non-employee director had in effect on the date of grant, plus any options that were forfeited, such as options granted to other non-employee directors. The non-employee director does not receive his/her restricted stock unit award or option grant if the non-employee director exercised the stock option on the date of grant, or the non-employee director’s stock award is forfeited, or if the grant date fair value is less than the grant date fair value for the grant date to the non-employee director.

results.question: How is Basic earnings per share, or EPS calculated?
gold_answer: by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period, without consideration for common stock equivalents.
results.markdown_table_response:
Basic earnings per share, or EPS, is calculated by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period, without consideration for common stock equivalents. Diluted EPS is computed by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period and the weighted-average number of dilutive common stock equivalents outstanding for the period determined using the treasury-stock method.
For purposes of this calculation, common stock options, restricted stock units and restricted stock awards are considered to be common stock equivalents and are only included in the calculation of diluted EPS when their effect is dilutive. In periods in which the Company has a net loss, dilutive common stock equivalents are excluded from the calculation of diluted EPS.
The table below presents the computation of basic and diluted earnings per share:
For the years ended December 31, 2019, 2018 and 2017, the Company incurred net losses and accordingly excluded common stock equivalents for outstanding stockbased awards, which represented all potentially dilutive securities, of 2.5 million, 3.7 million, and 4.5 million, respectively, from the calculation of diluted net loss per share due to their anti-dilutive nature.

Net sales increased $19.7 million (10.8%) in 2018 to $202.0 million. The increase was primarily driven by an increase in net sales in the distributor channel across all the APAC and EMEA regions of $13.7 million, a $3.3 million increase in net sales in the OEM channel of the EMEA region, a $4.2 million increase in the EMS channel across the Americas, EMEA, and APAC regions, and a $4.2 million increase in the OEM channel.
Segment operating income (loss) of $3.6 million in 2018 improved $12.7 million from $9.0 million of operating loss in 2017. The improvement was primarily attributable to a $4.3 million increase in gross margin driven by higher net sales, as well as the benefit of completed restructuring activities. The increase was also partially offset by a $11.7 million improvement in (gain) loss on the write down and disposal of long-lived assets.
